guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's code of conduct to ensure a welcoming and inclusive environment for all contributors.

guidelines.title: Submit Issues
guidelines.description: Report bugs, feature requests, or other issues through the GitHub Issues page to ensure they are tracked and addressed properly.

guidelines.title: Fork Repository
guidelines.description: Fork the repository into your own GitHub account to create personal copies, which can be used for your development work and testing.

guidelines.title: Create Branches
guidelines.description: Work in the dedicated branches for your contributions to keep the master/main branch clean and stable.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear, concise commit messages to document the changes accurately, which helps understand the project's history and facilitates easier navigation.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submit pull requests for your contributions to be reviewed, discussed, and potentially merged into the main project repository.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Follow the project's coding style and guidelines to ensure consistency and readability within the codebase.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: Take part in the review process if invited, providing constructive feedback and help to improve the quality of contributions.

guidelines.title: Stay Updated
guidelines.description: Keep your local and forked repositories up-to-date with the latest changes from the original repository to avoid conflicts and ensure compatibility.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Run the project's tests before submitting contributions to verify that your changes do not introduce any new bugs or issues.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: All contributors must adhere to the code of conduct which ensures a welcoming and inclusive community.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: When reporting issues, provide a clear and descriptive title and add as much detail as possible including steps to reproduce the bug and the expected behavior.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submit pull requests for proposed changes, ensuring the PR is well-documented and includes a detailed description of what changes were made and why.

guidelines.title: Branch Naming
guidelines.description: Use descriptive and meaningful names for branches following the specified naming conventions to indicate the purpose of the branch.

guidelines.title: Code Reviews
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews of pull requests. Provide constructive feedback and address comments in your own PRs.

guidelines.title: Follow Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's coding standards and use tools to ensure code quality, readability, and consistency.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: Update documentation with any relevant information whenever making changes to code to ensure it remains up-to-date and accurate.

guidelines.title: Test Changes
guidelines.description: Write and run tests for any code changes to ensure new features work as expected and existing functionalities are not broken.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear and concise commit messages that describe the changes made, following the project's commit message guidelines.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's code of conduct by treating others with respect and courtesy, ensuring a harassment-free experience for everyone. This helps maintain a welcoming and inclusive environment.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Report issues with detailed information, including steps to reproduce, expected outcomes, and actual behavior. This helps maintainers understand and address problems efficiently.

guidelines.title: Pull Request Process
guidelines.description: Follow the pull request process, including branching from the main branch, writing clear commit messages, and ensuring all tests pass before submission. This ensures that contributions are well-organized and maintain the project's quality.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's coding standards and style guidelines. This promotes consistency and readability across the codebase, making it easier for all contributors to understand and maintain the code.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: Include updates to documentation when making changes to the code, ensuring that all aspects of the project are well-documented and up-to-date. This helps users and future contributors understand the project's functionality and usage.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: Understand and participate in the code review process, providing constructive feedback and addressing comments on your contributions. This ensures that all changes are thoroughly vetted and meet quality standards.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Write and run tests for your contributions to validate your changes and prevent future regressions. This helps maintain the project's stability and reliability.

guidelines.title: Communication
guidelines.description: Use the project's preferred communication channels for discussions, questions, and feedback. This helps keep all information centralized and accessible for all contributors.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: A set of standards for respectful and inclusive behavior to ensure a welcoming environment for all contributors.

guidelines.title: How to Report Issues
guidelines.description: Instructions on how to properly report bugs or issues, including providing a clear description, context, and steps to reproduce the problem.

guidelines.title: Submitting Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Guidelines on how to create and submit pull requests, including branching, commit messages, and adherence to the project's coding standards.

guidelines.title: Feature Requests
guidelines.description: Information on how to request new features, including providing a rationale and potential use cases for the proposed feature.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Rules regarding coding style, such as indentation, formatting, and naming conventions, to maintain consistency across the codebase.

guidelines.title: Writing Documentation
guidelines.description: Guidelines for contributing to project documentation, including structure, tone, and format of the documentation content.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Standards for writing and running tests to ensure the reliability and stability of the code, including guidelines for different types of tests.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: Details about the code review process, including expectations for reviewers and contributors, and how feedback should be addressed.

guidelines.title: Licensing
guidelines.description: Information about the project's licensing, including requirements for contributors to agree to and follow the terms of the license.

guidelines.title: Fork the Repository
guidelines.description: Developers should start by forking the repository to their own GitHub account. This ensures that they can work on their own version of the project without affecting the original codebase.

guidelines.title: Clone Your Fork
guidelines.description: After forking, developers need to clone the repository to their local machine. This allows them to work on the code locally and use Git for version control.

guidelines.title: Create a Branch
guidelines.description: Developers should create a new branch for each feature or bug fix. Working in branches helps to organize code changes and makes it easier to manage different improvements or fixes separately.

guidelines.title: Commit Changes
guidelines.description: Once changes are made, developers need to commit them with clear and concise commit messages. This practice helps to maintain a clear project history for easier tracking of changes.

guidelines.title: Push to GitHub
guidelines.description: After committing changes locally, developers need to push their branch to their GitHub fork. This uploads their committed changes to their remote repository.

guidelines.title: Create a Pull Request
guidelines.description: Finally, developers should open a pull request to the original repository. Pull requests allow the project maintainers to review the changes before merging them into the main codebase.

guidelines.title: Code Review
guidelines.description: Developers should be prepared to participate in code reviews. Providing and receiving feedback on code helps ensure the quality and maintainability of the project.

guidelines.title: Follow Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Contributions should adhere to the project's coding standards and guidelines. Consistent code style and practices improve readability and maintainability.

guidelines.title: Include Tests
guidelines.description: Where applicable, contributions should include tests to verify that the new code works correctly and does not introduce regressions. Testing is vital for maintaining the stability of the project.

guidelines.title: Update Documentation
guidelines.description: Developers should update or add to the documentation if their changes affect how the project is used or its functionalities. Up-to-date documentation is crucial for helping users and other developers understand the project.
